title: Welcome!
text:
Neighborhoods in Richmond - A quick report exploring the GIS shapefile from City of Richmond containing a listing of neighborhoods in the City. The boundary for The Fan can be pulled from here and used to find addresses and parcels located within The fan.
Sample Dashboard - A quick dashboard highlighting some of the dashboard features built into Quarto.

The top left panel contains a leaflet map of the fan. One can zoom in and out and pan around to explore the city or world.
The top right panel contains a display of the neighborhood shapefile downloaded from City of Richmond. Look at the report above for more details.
the cards across the bottom contain dummy data and in the code present different ways to create cards.

Mini Dashboard - A mini project based on the homes that served as hosts for the “Holiday House Tour” since 1963.

Includes:

Pins on a map highlighting all the addresses

List of addresses sorted by street
Search bar to look for specific properties, people, and years
Number cards with the number of years, number of homes, and number of homes that participated two or more times.

title: Welcome!
text:
Neighborhoods in Richmond - A quick report exploring the GIS shapefile from City of Richmond containing a listing of neighborhoods in the City. The boundary for The Fan can be pulled from here and used to find addresses and parcels located within The fan.
Sample Dashboard - A quick dashboard highlighting some of the dashboard features built into Quarto.

The top left panel contains a leaflet map of the fan. One can zoom in and out and pan around to explore the city or world.
The top right panel contains a display of the neighborhood shapefile downloaded from City of Richmond. Look at the report above for more details.
the cards across the bottom contain dummy data and in the code present different ways to create cards.

Mini Dashboard - A mini project based on the homes that served as hosts for the “Holiday House Tour” since 1963.

Includes:

Pins on a map highlighting all the addresses

List of addresses sorted by street
Search bar to look for specific properties, people, and years
Number cards with the number of years, number of homes, and number of homes that participated two or more times.

Many changes to the workbook are made here in the python code. However, some changes were required directly in the original workbook. This workbook was renamed to reflect the changes.


Here is the code and the first 20 records.

if (0):

    df = load_csv_file(
        CSV_HHT_FILE,
        skip_rows=3,             # Skip first 3 rows (0-based index)
        header_row=None,         # No header row in the file
        column_names=["data"]    # Manually assign column name

else:

        EXCEL_HHT_FILE,
        skip_rows=3,             # Skip first 3 rows (0-based index)
        header_row=None,         # No header row in the file
        column_names=["data"],   # Manually assign column name

title: Holiday House Tour
text:
The Fan District Association’s annual Holiday House Tour in Richmond, Virginia, is a cherished tradition that invites visitors to explore the neighborhood’s historic homes adorned in festive holiday decor. Held each December, the self-guided walking tour showcases a variety of architectural styles, including Queen Anne, Italianate, Tudor Revival, and Colonial Revival, reflecting the area’s development between 1890 and 1930. richmondmagazine.com
The 2024 tour featured eight properties, seven of which were open to the public for the first time, offering a unique glimpse into the district’s rich architectural tapestry . Attendees could stroll through the neighborhood or utilize complimentary tuk-tuk rides provided along the route.​ richmondmagazine.com
Proceeds from the event support the Fan District Association’s initiatives, including neighborhood preservation, restoration projects, and community enhancements. This festive tour not only celebrates the holiday season but also fosters community spirit and appreciation for Richmond’s historic charm.
The Fan District Association maintains a workbook documenting previous holiday house tours.
This document represents an analysis of the workbook and it’s associated cleaned data file.

text:
The City of Richmond maintains an arcgis geodata repository called Richmond GeoHub.
Data on the geohub are organized into key areas. For our analysis, we’ll be using the following data sources.
For our Fan District analysis we will be working with Civic Associations to get the formal boundary of the Fan District Association.
We then use that boundary to determine Addresses and Parcels in the Fan District Association
